p.strong: THIS IS AN EXAMPLE USER DATA PRIVACY STATEMENT. Please edit with your policies!

epp:phrase.p: In creating this account you agree to the personal data you supply being stored in the United Kingdom and maintained by , through University of Leeds IT Service, on behalf of White Rose Libraries and the Universities of Leeds, Sheffield and York. This data may be accessed by colleagues from across these three institutions if necessary e.g. to offer support or resolve an issue. The data, including your institutional affiliation, will also be used to better understand the use and effectiveness of the service and identify areas for improvement. Individuals will not be identifiable from any generated outputs. These uses come under the following lawful basis under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) 2018:

blockquote.p: 6 (1) (e) - Processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.

epp:phrase.p: Should you use your account to deposit your thesis/your research we will retain your personal data for the duration of our curation of this thesis/content.

Should you not use your account to deposit content, the account will remain live for 12 months from last recorded activity. After this period, the account, along with any personal data it contains, will be deleted.

The Universities recognise the importance of personal privacy and ensure that all personal data is held in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) 2018. Compliance is managed by Data Protection colleagues across the sites, and the Data Controller for White Rose operations is the University of York, on behalf of the Universities of Leeds, Sheffield and York.

Under the General Data Protection Regulation, you have a right of access to your data, a right to rectification, erasure (in certain circumstances), restriction, objection or portability (in certain circumstances). You also have a right to withdraw consent. If you would like to exercise these rights, or if you have any concerns or questions relating to Data Protection, please contact:

epp:phrase.p: In using this account to deposit your thesis, you agree to the personal data you supply being stored in the United Kingdom and maintained by , through University of Leeds IT Service, on behalf of White Rose Libraries and the Universities of Leeds, Sheffield and York. This data may be accessed by colleagues from across these three institutions if necessary e.g. to offer support or resolve an issue. The data, including your institutional affiliation, will also be used to better understand the use and effectiveness of the service and identify areas for improvement. Individuals will not be identifiable from any generated outputs. These uses come under the following lawful basis under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) 2018:

blockquote.p: 6 (1) (e) - Processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.

epp:phrase.p: The data will be retained for the duration of our curation of your thesis.

Depositing your thesis with adds it to a national - and international - network of open access online databases which promote access to research outputs so that they can be found, read, cited and built upon. Theses available in will be available to all. Potential readers will be able to find your thesis through an ordinary search engine such as Google but also through other specialist, academic search engines, maximising the impact and profile of your research.

Some of the data you share will be used to create the record page for your thesis, in accordance with any limitations you set as part of the deposit process. This will not include your email address or any direct contact details. Staff from White Rose Libraries, Leeds IT Service, and the Universities of Leeds, Sheffield and York may use these details to contact you about your thesis. If your thesis is embargoed, requests for access during the embargo period will be sent to the email address you supply as the "contact email" for the thesis. White Rose Libraries will not share your contact details with the requestor.

The Universities recognise the importance of personal privacy and ensure that all personal data is held in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) 2018. Compliance is managed by Data Protection colleagues across the sites, and the Data Controller for White Rose Libraries operations is the University of York, on behalf of the Universities of Leeds, Sheffield and York.

Please note that the responsibility for gathering appropriate permissions relating to any personal data held within your thesis, including relating to deposit in this repository, lie with you as the researcher. You must ensure any such permissions are in place to the satisfaction of your University before depositing your thesis.

epp:phrase.p: As this content is currently not publically available you need to request access, either from the author or other specified contact with the authority to grant access to this item.
epp:phrase.h2: How do we use your data and who do we share it with?
epp:phrase.p: To allow them to consider your access request fully, we need to provide the author or other specified contact with your details, including the reason you are requesting access and your contact details to enable them to respond.
Your data may be also be accessed by colleagues from White Rose Libraries and the Universities of Leeds, Sheffield and York if necessary e.g. to offer support or resolve an issue.
The data will also be used to better understand the use and effectiveness of the service and identify areas for improvement. Individuals will not be identifiable from any generated outputs.
epp:phrase.h2: How long will we keep your data?
epp:phrase.p: will retain the details you submit in your request as part of our records concerning the restricted content we curate. We will retain this data until the requested item is made publicly available, or for 12 months (whichever is the longer period).

epp:phrase.p: Data gathered as part of the 'Request a Copy' service will be processed under article 6 (1) (b) of the GDPR, i.e. to allow us to perform a contract with you or take steps at your request, to enter into a contract.
